bugDatas.title: Array Index Out of Range in Python Loop
bugDatas.desc:
numbers = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50]

for i in range(len(numbers) + 1):  # I thought this would go through all elements
    print(numbers[i])

bugDatas.title: Same Python Index Error – Version 2
bugDatas.desc:
numbers = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50]

for i in range(len(numbers) + 1):  # I thought this would go through all elements
    print(numbers[i])

bugDatas.desc:

for i in range(len(numbers) + 1):  # I thought this would go through all elements
    print(numbers[i])

bugDatas.title: Python IndexError When Looping with len+1
bugDatas.desc: This error occurs because `range(len(array) + 1)` tries to access an out-of-bounds index at the last iteration.

bugDatas.title: Understanding Python Range Errors in Looping
bugDatas.desc: Trying to access an index equal to the array's length will always raise an `IndexError` in Python.
